Uses of Package
cs155.jray

  • Classes in cs155.jray used by cs155.jray 
    Class and Description
    Camera3D
    This class represents a camera.
    Canvas3D
    a canvas is any Java object that supports these methods one must be able to compute the height and width of the canvas and to draw a pixel of a given color on the canvas.
    Color3D
    This represents color objects, where the red, green, and blue components are non-negative doubles.
    Film 
    Group3D
    This class represents a group of Objects.
    Light3D
    This represents 3D lights with the full OpenGL color model.
    Material
    This represents a material (either inside or outside on an object) it contains Color3D values for the emissive, ambient, diffuse, and specular reflection properties of the material as well as a hardness coefficient for the specular reflection.
    NewRayCanvas3D
    This class creates a panel where one can draw pixels
    Object3D
    This is now an abstract class representing raytraceable objects with inside and outside materials
    Point3D
    A Point3D is a triple of doubles that can represent a point or a vector.
    Ray3D
    A Ray3D consists of a point and a (normalized) direction.
    RayHit
    This class stores severalo pieces of information about the intersection of a Ray with an object: the distance to the intersection along the ray, the normal to the object at that intersection point, the object hit, the texture coordinates of the object
    Scene3D
    This represents a 3d scene that can be drawn on a Canvas3D object.
    Transform3D
    this class represented 3d affine transforms
